required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Isonicotinic Acid Hydrazide (INH) Pretreatment With Misoprostol Versus Misoprostol Alone in Missed Abortion
clinical_study.official_title: Adjuvant Isonicotinic Acid Hydrazide (INH) Pretreatment With Misoprostol for Induction of Abortion in First-trimester Missed Miscarriage: A Randomized Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: The primary endpoint was the success rate of adjuvant isonicotinic acid hydrazide (INH) and misoprostol versus misoprostol alone for medical termination of first-trimester pregnancy.

detailed_description.textblock:
According to the American college of obstetricians and gynecologists (2005), medical abortion is an acceptable alternative for surgical procedures in pregnant women with gestational age of less than 10 weeks based on the last menstrual period
Oral or vaginal misoprostol causes complete abortion in almost 85% of cases within seven days before the 12th week
Adjuvant isonicotinic acid hydrazide (INH) administration with misoprostol raises the rate of complete abortion

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: double blind randomized parallel assign controlled trial
study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)
study_design_info.masking_description: double blind randomized parallel assign controlled trial

primary_outcome.measure: number of patients with complete abortion
primary_outcome.description: number of patients with complete abortion

secondary_outcome.measure: number of the women will undergo dilatation and curettage after failed medical induction of abortion
secondary_outcome.description: number of the women will undergo dilatation and curettage after failed medical induction of abortion

arm_group.description: 3 tablets of isonicotinic acid hydrazide 300 mg will be given as single daily doses, 5 mg per day for two days at home and the third dose will be given on admission to hospital on day 3 and will be followed by vaginal misoprostol 800 mcg every three hours up to maximum three doses.
Misoprostol Alone 800 mcg every three hours up to maximum three doses

intervention.description: total dose 900 mg per day for 3 days then Misoprosrol 800mcg will be given to all patients for induction of abortion
Misoprosrol 800mcg will be given to all patients for induction of abortion

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Gestational age less than 70 days gestation (<10 wks)
- Hemoglobin >10 g/dL.
- BMI between 18.5 kg/m2 and 30 kg/m2.
- Missed abortion
Exclusion Criteria:
- Molar pregnancy.
- Fibroid uterus.
- Uterine anomalies.
- Coagulopathy.
- Medical disorder that contraindicate induction of abortion (e.g. heart failure).
- Previous attempts for induction of abortion in the current pregnancy.
- Allergy to misoprostol or letrozole.
- Scared uterus (previous myomectomy, cesarean section, hysterectomy and ruptured uterus).

eligibility.gender_description: pregnant women with gestational age of less than 10 week
